1.title: Milk and Ice Vintage
1.plot: The Vintage Voyageur visits Milk and Ice Vintage in the historic Hampden District of Baltimore, MD. Owned by Angie Gavin and Kate Thomas, Allison learns how these best friends turned their passion into a successful business while browsing their rare and unique pieces.

2.title: Hey Betty Vintage
2.plot: The Vintage Voyageur travels to Pittsburgh, PA to visit Hey Betty Vintage. With the help of owner, Michael Ferrucci, Allison discovers rare fashions from the fifties, sixties and seventies, and learns stories of their past wearers. Includes a Vintage 101 on the difference between vintage and thrift shopping.

3.title: Transporter Retro and Royal Vintage Shoes
3.plot: The Vintage Voyageur travels to Atlanta, GA to visit Transporter Vintage and Retro, the new and eclectic vintage toy shop in town. With the help of owner, Chris Shubert, Allison feels like a kid again when rummaging through unique collectibles of the past. Includes an interview with Lauren Stowell and Abby Cox, owners of Royal Vintage Shoes.

4.title: La Loupe Vintage
4.plot: The Vintage Voyageur travels to her hometown of San Diego, CA to visit La Loupe Vintage in the artistic Normal Heights neighborhood. With the help of owner Brandi Munoz, Allison discovers psychedelic pieces from the seventies, and learns just how big an impact a small business can have on its community.

5.title: The Clothing Warehouse
5.plot: The Vintage Voyageur heads back to Atlanta, GA to visit The Clothing Warehouse. With the help of store manager, Megan Poole, Allison navigates through the giant warehouse and learns all about the famous big red building while finding unforgettable western dresses. Includes a Vintage 101 on denim care.

6.title: Olly Oxenfree Vintage
6.plot: The Vintage Voyageur travels to Brooklyn, NY to visit Olly Oxen Free Vintage. With the help of owner, Suzy Palmer, Allison finds colorful items dating from the fifties to the eighties and learns of the multiple ways Suzy's shop is impacting her community through the use of yoga and sustainable fashion.

7.title: Vignettes Decor
7.plot: The Vintage Voyageur returns to her hometown of San Diego to visit Vignettes Decor. Voted San Diego's Best Antique Shop of 2016, Vignette's is known for their upscale antiques with a Parisian flair. With the help of employee, Daniel, and jewelry vendor, Erik, Allison learns the perks of buying big when browsing the shops playful pieces. Includes a Vintage 101 on the pros of shopping second hand.

8.title: Spend a Day with Abby Mills
8.plot: In this special episode, we spend a day with a different vintage voyageur, Abby Mills, creator of fashion blog Clothes and Pizza. A Brooklyn girl with a unique style all her own, Abby takes us on a shopping and eating tour of Brooklyn while sharing her personal fashion tips and what vintage means to her.

9.title: James Veloria
9.plot: The Vintage Voyageur finds herself once again in Brooklyn. This time at the showroom of James Veloria, an online vintage brand specializing in avant garde fashions of the 80's and 90's. With the help of owners Brandon and Collin, Allison learns how to bring high fashion pieces off the runway and into every day life. Features a surprise ending with music provided by Primme.

10.title: Vintage Queens
10.plot: In this final episode of the season, The Vintage Voyageur visits Vintage Queens in Astoria, NY. Allison brings along best gal pal, Ebony Deloney, a vintage novice skeptical of vintage clothing's fit. With the help of owner, Jade Oliver, Ebony picks up helpful tips on finding the perfect piece and learns that vintage can be worn by all, regardless of shape and size.

1.title: Screaming Mimi's
1.plot: The Vintage Voyageur visits New York's iconic Screaming Mimi's on Lafayette St. and shares some valuable lessons for those just starting to wear vintage. Also, a 'how to' session of four ways to wear a shawl as a top.

2.title: Search and Destroy
2.plot: The Vintage Voyageur visits Search And Destroy in Manhattan's iconic St. Mark's Place and experiments with different punk rock looks. Also, a quick lesson on vintage sizing during a special Vintage 101 segment.

3.title: Another Man's Treasure Vintage
3.plot: The Vintage Voyageur visits Another Man's Treasure Vintage in Jersey City. With the help of owner, Meika Franz, we experiment with vintage specialty items and give tips to vintage novices, all while having a lot of fun. Features a special operatic musical ending.

4.title: Mr. Throwback
4.plot: The Vintage Voyageur visits Mr. Throwback, a vintage store specializing in men's 80's and 90's sports paraphernalia. With the help of owner, Mike Spitz, we talk growing up in the 90's, collaborations and sports. And while Allison does not walk away an expert on the latter, she does learn how to rock a sports jersey her way. Includes a Vintage 101 segment all about personal style!

5.title: Rue St. Denis
5.plot: The Vintage Voyageur visits Rue St. Denis, a vintage store specializing in unworn vintage. Together, with the help of friend and vintage novice, Quinten, we try on menswear from the 70's and learn valuable lessons on proper tailoring in a special segment of Vintage 101.

6.title: Pippin Vintage Jewelry
6.plot: The Vintage Voyageur visits Pippin Vintage Jewelry and Pippin Home on New York's West 17th St. With the help of store manager Tatianni Gagner and a new furry friend, Allison tries on everything from diamonds to costume jewelry and learns that items built in the past were made to last.

7.title: Ritual Vintage
7.plot: In the season 1 finale of The Vintage Voyageur, we visit Ritual Vintage, located in New York's hip Nolita neighborhood. With the help of owner Stacy Iannacone, we learn about proper ways to store vintage, try on a mix of antique and vintage clothing, and talk about dressing for the life you want.

locations: New York City, New York, USA::(on location)
Jersey City, New Jersey, USA::(on location)
imdb.plot outline: A sartorial how to series taking you to unique and high end vintage stores in New York City and across America. Creator and host, Allison Maldonado goes on the road to discover how vintage shopping differs from city to city and highlights the importance of shopping small. Includes interviews with shop owners, fashion history lessons and tips on personal style.
imdb.title: The Vintage Voyageur
plot: Created and hosted by Allison Maldonado, this sartorial how to series promotes personal style and provides history lessons on fashions of the past while shopping through unique and high end vintage stores.

A sartorial how to series taking you to unique and high end vintage stores in New York City and across America. Creator and host, Allison Maldonado goes on the road to discover how vintage shopping differs from city to city and highlights the importance of shopping small. Includes interviews with shop owners, fashion history lessons and tips on personal style.
